Reviews.Title: “BIG MISTAKE”
Reviews.Author: Jason S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in the summer of 2007. We found it to be small but clean, the breakfast was great, and the location ideal. When we booked another trip for the spring of 2012 we again chose this hotel. BIG MISTAKE!!! We reserved two rooms, a double for my wife and me and a triple for our three teenage boys. Upon arriving at the hotel I was told the toilet in the triple room was not working but we could have two doubles. Obviously this isn't going to work since we have five people. We ended up getting two doubles and a single so, for the moment, crisis averted. I asked the girl what time breakfast would be served in the morning and she told me there isn't breakfast because the kitchen flooded last week. I explained to her it was going to cost me an additional £35 to feed my family breakfast each day. She offered to knock off £5/day but only on the second and third nights we were staying. After a little bit of reasoning I got her to knock off £15 for the last two nights. No refund was offered for the first night. The explanation being that the first night was used as a deposit and was non-refundable. We get into our room and I step into the bathroom to freshen up so we can hit the streets and see some sights. It took over three minutes to get hot water to the sink and it wasn't until my sock was wet that I realized the sink was leaking. Awesome. I Checked out the double room that my sons were sharing and it seemed to be in good working order. The single room my nephew was in was a different story. The walls were stained with I don't know what and the paint in the corner of the ceiling was peeling off and hanging down. We left the hotel to go out for the evening which proved to be chilly, around 40*. When we got back to the hotel we discovered the heat was not working. The rooms were freezing! To make matters worse they had no additional blankets to use. To make matters even worse my nephew got sick in his toilet. This is how we found out the toilet in his room wasn't working either! I don't know if it's legal to rent a room without providing heat. When I confronted the girl I explained this was unacceptable and I should have been contacted about the ongoing problems (no heat & toilet in triple room not working). At least I could've had the opportunity to make other arrangements. Needless to say we found rooms for the next two nights at a hotel two doors down from this hell hole. Again when we stayed here in '07 it was quaint and clean but it now looks like they haven't done a thing to the place since we left almost five years ago! The place is in total disrepair.

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare from hell”
Reviews.Author: Sonicjess
Reviews.Content: I've been working at Alexander Hotel, September-November 2010, and I will recommend all of you travelers to stay away from this hotel. It's fairly expensive compared to the other hotels in the Victoria area. I only worked there for three months but I had to manage the hotel by my own since the owner never showed up. He never answered his phone and didn't really care what happened to the hotel. My ''titel'' was a chambermaid but I worked as a receptionist, a janitor, a manager and a breakfast cook. I did it all. So if you want a pleasant stay in London search for another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: mariana t
Reviews.Content: yeah if we have to find a name for this hotel we should call it bed bugs rooms they eat you for free!! i cant believe people dont clean i stayed 2 nights with my family , we paid 130 pounds per night, i really think dont worth it , there are 3 russian girls there and they dont speak good english, i saw them working as recepcionist, in the kitchen, cleaning they do everything, but you can never talk to them if is any problem , they disapear...... me and my brother we have been bitten completedly by beg bugs , looking beautiful in our vacations pictures about the free breadfast the first day they did not have any food, really was horrible servise , so please never go there, i hope the owner of the hotel put more atention

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs, lousy service, no sleep, no refund”
Reviews.Author: rogeiro
Reviews.Content: Went to London in September, thought we had a bargain for 70 pounds per night in the Victoria whereabouts. The first night we were assigned room no. 2, the room was far below average but worst of all we were bitten by bedbugs. In the morning a girl from Spain which acts as cook and cleaning staff took also the receptionist role and switched us to room no. 3. Room 3 greeted us with a worn down carpet and hole in the floor where you could step into broken wood and a couple of rusty nails, the bathroom was so tiny I could not shower without hitting the shower valve and inevitably changing from freezing to scalding water, also the faucet was outside of the tiny bathroom. We thought we had left the bedbugs behind but on the third night we found many lying around on one of the beds. Again staff was unavailable apart from the cook/cleaner/part-time receptionist who, of course, in spite of her best efforts could not offer us a valid solution. We had paid for a fourth night but decided to leave and paid about half the rate for a far cleaner and better room on the Easy Hotel just accross the street. In summary: paid for 4 nights, stayed 3, slept just one night. The manager a guy that goes by the name of Raphael took two weeks to answer his mobile, offered me a refund for the fourth night but I still haven't got it. Believe me, the only good thing about this hotel is the location and I am certain this is the only thing that keeps it alive, but within a 2-block range from the Alexander Hotel there are about 10 more hotels and at least 3 of them with comparable rates. Don't waste your money here, It would have been more comfortable to stay in Victoria Station!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, horrible, horrible”
Reviews.Author: Kate M
Reviews.Content: I would rather spend a night on a park bench than spend money being ripped off in this WORST HOTEL EVER I have spent a night in. Our first greeting was peeling ceilings and an impossibly small 'double room'. We immediately asked for a better room. The only thing better was not having to climb several flights of stairs. The room smelled damp. The mattress was lumpy and blood stained. Bed bugs had dinner on our bodies, and the fried eggs and bacon on the breakfast menu were unavailable. To top it all off the reception staff were unable to speak reasonable English. The manager was nowhere to be seen. We saw a certificate of membership of the Federation of Small Businesses in the name of Mr R Montagnani. May I respectfully request he spend a night in his own hotel and then ask himself whether he should still be advertising accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs pics. Please dont stay here never!”
Reviews.Author: Moonlight T
Reviews.Content: I want to share with you some pics of my neck and bedbugs that I found in this terrible and disgusting place, next time really I will sleep in the street. This dump needs to be closed !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nasty, Nasty, Nasty”
Reviews.Author: Isobel77
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just one night and believe me I was relieved I had not planned to stay longer. Only stayed here last minute as every other hotel we looked at was fully booked. Cost was £70 for a double room which is pretty reasonable for Victoria. After staying there cant imagine they would be able to charge anymore. It really is disgusting, cant really understand why it has not been closed down, i am sure it must have hygene and health and safety issues!!! I believe breakfast was included in the price but after seeing the room there is no way I would eat there, can not imagine what the state of the kitchen it like. Room was foul, dirty, dusty, probably bed bugs, the thing that made my stomach turn was the foul rusty toilet brush holder next to toilet, not that they probably used it much!!! If you plan to stay here good luck, but personally would probably rather sleep on the pavement outside!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: Speaker2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 days and I really stayed in hell! The front of the hotel looks convincing as soon as you get to the tiny reception your heart start pumping fast! The place smells damp everywhere, the ceilings are falling apart, broken door locks, broken toilet door locks, very old carpet that looks 40 years old. Abandoned furnitures, dust, bedbugs, 1970 tv with no remote, no kettle or phone in the room. My friend was told he should have brought in an iron as they do not provide one. No lift, you will have to climb the Himalayas in this hotel, once you get to the top, there in oxygen, a good place for horror movies! How on earth can the British government allow this place to trade? The owner is negligent! Please avoid this hotel from hell!

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL WHERE I'VE EVER STAYED AT”
Reviews.Author: EmanuelMEXCY
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to post a review about this horrible hotel. It was such a bad experience. Good points: * Close to Victoria Station which makes easy your traveling across London and England Bad points: * Soooo old rooms * Fire traces and not useful toilet in my friend's room * Fleas and bedbugs in the triple room beside the reception, as a well as a ridiculously small bathroom where you are not able to bend 'cuz you don't fit in the tight walls * No way to contact the staff after 11pm * Dirty facilities * More EXPENSIVE compared to the prices with the neighbour hotels £75 in double room and £100 in the triple room. The prices in neighbour hotels are £50 in double room and £75 in triple room, with breakfast included. * Tatooed cook girl whom serves food and attends reception while the receptionist is not available! * Not satellital tv as offered in the website * Not Wi-Fi available as offered in the website * Slim walls, you are able to hear EVERYTHING in your neighbours rooms, disgusting! Well, I don't recommend this nasty hotel at all and advice you to search in neighbour hotels as easyhotel or Belgrave Hotel (both of them in front of the Alexander, with much better facilities and CHEAPER rate ), or Stanley Hotel (2 doors away) for similar facilities but clean and with light. Me and a friend of mine made a tour door to door through the area hotels 'cuz it is not possible to be at Alexander. It's more than you can stand! Horrible! At the end we moved to the Stanley hotel since Belgrave Hotel and EasyHotel were totally booked. Ahh, close to the Alexander you can also find a Best Western hotel! Make sure you won't stay in this nasty hotel, the hotel info is 13 Belgrave Road - Victoria - London - SW1V 1RB - England Tel: +44 (0)20 7834 9738 - Fax: +44 (0)20 7630 9630 ad the website is http://www.alexanderhotel.co.uk/

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the bedbugs bite!”
Reviews.Author: Gogogirl45
Reviews.Content: Not a great experience. As soon as possible, I had to move. Run by young girls from out of the country--with no recourse when there were problems. I did finally manage to get a refund, but that didn't compensate for moving from room to room and the bug problem!! Also, the fan and t.v. in one room didn't work, and contrary to what their really wonderful site implied, there was no internet available.

Reviews.Title: “poorly maintained and extremely dirty”
Reviews.Author: LoriRae
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in 1996 and 1997. I do not believe they have vacuumed since. The sink was cracked. The toilet seat did not fit properly. The carpet was heavily stained, damaged,and filthy. Do not take the single room. It was a claustrophic closet with a leaky sink. I did not eat the breakfast fearing the potential hygiene in the kitchen might be the same as the room care. Staff is friendly. Management is indifferent. I was planning to stay there two nights on my return to London. I told them I would not return due to the condition of the place and wanted my deposit back. That was almost 3 weeks notice. They refused but I was able to get VISA to refund part of it.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad - not so good”
Reviews.Author: Lincsdumpling
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexander Hotel last weekend when we went to see the London Marathon. I normally check things out with Tripadvisor first but we were pushed for time so I took a chance and made a booking then felt very worried when I read the reviews. So what was our experience? Well, on the positive side, it is very close to Victoria Station thus making London very accessible. We did not have any problem with the booking - we were late arriving but the nice woman on reception buzzed us in and was very polite and competent. The staff are mostly young European women and they were all helpful and charming. We were a bit early for breakfast but the young lady let us into the dining room and promptly took our order. The brekafast is not going to win awards but we had cereal followed by toast and scrambled egg along with a cup of tea. All perfectly adequate. On the downside, the rooms are small and although we had quite a nice tv in our room, the tiny one in our daughter's single room did not work. That said, we were out all day so that was not really an issue for us. The showers are ok but hot water is still hit and miss. The rooms are cleanish but they certainly are not particularly modern. My daughter thought her room was a joke when we opened the door to be faced with a doorless hanging wardrobe to the side and 2 white fire doors in front of us. In fact, the tiny single room was hidden behind these very springy doors. Hmm. Not sure that would impress anyone! Overall, they seem to have improved on the meet and greet front and the rooms are ok if you just want somewhere to dump your stuff and go off round London. The staff are also very good about allowing you to leave bags at reception once you check out. Would I use it again? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the place!”
Reviews.Author: racytraveller
Reviews.Content: Disgusting, horrible hotel. Nothing worked well and it was smelly and dirty looking. Do not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience with Alexander Hotel London”
Reviews.Author: CAP54
Reviews.Content: Filthy bathroom. Mold on the tiles. The drain from the shower upstairs leaked through the ceiling of the shower in our room (see photos). We checked out early because of the dirty conditions of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: beckagray
Reviews.Content: My mother and I arrived in London at 6am. Got a shuttle to the Alexander. When we arrived (after a 14 hour flight) there was no room for us until 12pm. Reception guy was unhelpful. Were able to get changed in a 1m sq toilet room and then headed out for breakfast. A shower would have been great - but no. When we finally we able to get to our room, we found a dingey little box of a room. The two single beds were about 2 feet apart, the beds, duvets etc were probably pre 1900s. It was a real let down for our first trip overseas. We would have happily paid way more for a decent sized room and a bit of polite, helpful service. Would only recommend this place for backpackers - but it would be beyond their budget!

Reviews.Title: “the door was closed...”
Reviews.Author: ventilo
Reviews.Content: We came from France for a two nights stay, and we had booked the Alexander Hotel using their website, with a full night advance payment. When arriving at the front door it was closed and there was a "hotel full" sign, no one answered the bell, we tried to phone the hotel and heard the ringing inside but no one answered... After 20 minutes waiting we decided to look for another hotel and luckily we got one room at the one next door, alas only for the first night. One hour later we got out for dinner, and we saw that the Alexander Hotel receptionist was back ! I then had an explanation, the guy said he was out for only five minutes... I asked if we could come the day after and enjoy our second night but he just reimbursed my advance payment and told me he had no room available !! What a reliable place, and what a warm welcome to London, this is a shame.

Reviews.Title: “This was my worst hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: traveler1212_7
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Alexander Hotel on November 12, 2007 for a 3-night stay from November 30-December 3, 2007. I was not able to stay at the Alexander because on my day of arrival no one was at the hotel to let me in. I arrived a little before the estimated time of arrival which was 3pm and waited several hours in the rain. After waiting a couple hours I went across the street to the hotel that turned out to be owned by the brother of the owner of the Alexander. I called the Alexander Hotel but no one answered the phone. Finally, I was forced to find another hotel for the night. I left a note explaining what had happened and asked for a refund of the deposit that had already been charged to my credit card A few days later, I checked back in and spoke with a man who said that he would refund my deposit, but its been over a month and the charge is still on my credit card. After traveling 14 hours from the states the last thing anyone needs is to have absolutely no one at the hotel. It would have been better if someone there would have just said they were all booked up. Let'sgo recommended this hotel in one of their london guides - my sincere advice is to book a room somewhere else - there are many hotels just down the street and I've never had a worse experience. At a minimum - a hotel should have someone present during normal business hours to receive those who booked well in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Functional, at best. Might try something else.”
Reviews.Author: EbethDallas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were trying to take in a lot of Europe in two weeks, and we didn't want to spend a lot of money on the places where we slept. Based on my research, hotels in London can be pretty expensive, so when I found a decent deal on the Alexander Hotel, I took it. We stayed there for two days, and the location was decent, but the accomodations were nothing to write home about. The room we stayed in was tiny with pretty much just enough room for the bed and a small table. The bed itself was comfortable. The bathroom was very small and the shower was a problem. The shower had warm water but sprayed in a strange pattern, and no matter what you do, the floor becomes thoroughly soaked. I believe I read this in another trip advisor review and thought that wouldn't be a big deal, but an inch of water covering the floor in cold London is really uncomfortable. If you take a shower in the evening, the water is waiting for you in the morning. God help you if you are wearing socks. We had a first floor room, but there is no elevator which may make it difficult for guests who have difficulty lifting their luggage. The breakfast was unremarkable but also unoffensive. I do have to say that the location was pretty nice. It was only a 5 minute walk from Victoria Station, and we actually rolled our luggage from the station to the hotel. We were also not far from the meeting point of our tour to Stonehenge. In its favor, the staff were very accomodating and met us back on a Saturday to give us our luggage that they had held while we explored the city. We were greeted warmly at midnight when we first arrived as well. For the sake of what feels like a family-run business with kind workers, I would like to recommend this hotel, but I greatly hesitate to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation Needed”
Reviews.Author: Macky300
Reviews.Content: Typical of RIP-OFF Britain. £75 P/NIGHT in London is cheap but you should still get some quality for that. Sad to say - This is not a qualtity hotel & needs a complete renovation. Old dirty paisley carpets, tatty worn out curtains, 1960'S bathroom tiles, an old mattress on top of another old mattress made a good nights sleep impossible. It was like sleeping on a water bed. Electrical sockets hanging from the wall, TV with bad reception tatty furtniture, radiator blocked by wardrobe, noisy rooms & street BREAKFAST - well not an English breakfast as described, only 2 items on the plate, egg & bacon, so what happened to the rest?. If this was abroad you would complain, but this is typical of some of the crap accomodation in Britain. I was glad to get out of the place. Forgot to say, upon arrival the toilet had not been cleaned from the previous occupants and there was feces in the toilet basin. I won't be returning! No wonder people go abroad!

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: gjpac
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alexander B&B is a great place to stay in London for cheap. It's near Victoria Station, walking distance to Buckingham Palace and Big Ben. Room and washroom are always clean. But if you don't already, I suggest to bring your own soap and shampoo as they don't provide you good stuff. ( i always do) Breakfast is great. Eggs and bacon with toast and fresh coffee or tea, orange juice. Or choice of cereals and fruits. They say they have a tv lounge,,,but we never found it. No concierge/reception 24-7. Near the supermarket. my husband and I love Indian food. there is a place called Indian Diner on Rochester way (sorry i forgot the address) but you can google it.

Reviews.Title: “not too bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok, not amazing really but neither was it bad. Staff were welcoming when i arrived and helped me find an address. Room itself was on the small side but clean and pleasant enough plus a fan was a bonus to get through the heat of the summer night. I may go back due to the location being so good.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wanted some where to stay close to victoria coach station and this is spot on , close to all of London's sites, but is in need of refurbishment . The decor in the bathroom was straight from the 60's & hasn't been changed since. bathroom was musty and the fan didn't work ,room was small , a double bed in a single room. Cooked breakfast could have more variety , excellent website for easy booking shame the hotel is not more up to date. probably would not stay here again unless they had undertaken refurbishments ....but you pays your money & takes a chance, as they say!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and cheap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not at all as bad as the last reviewer suggested, I found this place on the contrary to be quite good. Our room was indeed small but that is par for the course in Europe, and the bathroom was no closet, in fact it was a decent size with a big headed shower too. I was pleasantly surprised at the breakfast and the location is about five minutes from the main station. There are more hotels on this road but this is one of the closest to the station (maybe the closest?) and after spending the day touristing around the city it really takes it out of you so we were thankful for every step saved! Finally the place was packed every morning at breakfast, I always take this as a good sign for a restaurant or hotel when travelling. We paid 65 sterling per night. The five star around the corner wanted 120 - why bother if all you need is a cofortable sleep with breakfast?

Reviews.Title: “A little better then a hostel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights last May (2004). I was glad to leave. The place had an old smell to it. The bathroom was a converted closet and the toilet did not flush. There was a big hole in blanket. The room was very small but it seems that most hotel rooms in Europe are small unless you are willing to pay a lot of money. The only good think about this place was they had a fairly good english breakfast. It's also hard to find, even with the directions on their website. I wouldn't go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for a cheap place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Alexander is a fairly decent place to stay for the price, which is pretty cheap (for London). Our room was tiny, but that's a given and it was clean (although the bathroom was kind of grotty). We were in room 12 which had a balcony and it was lovely to sit out in the morning watching the kids in matching uniforms (with boaters!) going to a school on the same block. We did look out over Belgrave road so there was a lot of street noise, but nothing earplugs couldn't fix. The staff was all foreign college students who were quite friendly and the breakfast was basic but good.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Despite reading some mixed reviews we decided to stay last minute when a friend came back from a trip to London to say she had left another hotel on the same road (Holiday Inn) and moved to the Alexander hotel for a better price. Staff were helpful (the girl on reception found an indian restaurant on the internet for us) and the room was clean and bright, a bit tight around the edges but the shower in the bathroom had a fabulous extra large head which was just great! Price is right (65 pounds) and the place is close enough to the station to walk (which saved a cab fare). Bad points: breakfast is only to 9… we arrived just before 10 on our first day (but they gave us toast and coffee still). The weather was in a heatwave so without air conditioning we had to leave the window wide open all night but it wasn’t too bad. There was no hairdryer but again the receptionist gave us one to keep in the room when we asked. Summary: excellent website (our room WAS as shown on the site) with directions and information, genuine staff, location in a good spot, a few bits here and there but nothing major and nothing you wouldn’t expect in this price range anyway. At the end of our trip we left London feeling good, the Alexander is a friendly place to stay folks, if you ever go to London give it a look in!

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Alexander Hotel for four nights in May, and we found it to be a very pleasant experience, contrary to the previous reviewer. It is certainly what one would call a budget hotel, and travelers should expect to get what they pay for, as it is a relatively cheap option for London. The carpet may not have been exceptionally clean, but everything else was wonderful. We stayed on the first floor (second floor in the U.S.) and although our room was very small, it was comfortable and even had a balcony! It was very nice to sit out there in the evenings. Our room got street noise during the night, especially with the windows open for ventilation, but it was not a problem. I'm not sure if they have air conditioning in the hotter summer months; should check. We very much enjoyed the English breakfasts, finding the eggs not at all hard. There was a good selection of food. One of the best parts was the en suite bathroom, which is a rarity in London B&Bs in this price range. Ours was great except without a shower curtain. All in all, a very good option for someone on a budget and very acceptable. Also in an excellent location for sights and Victoria Station. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Small, Clean & Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingASAP
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small but the hotel is clean and the service excellent! We had room 12 which overlooked the busy street, but had a small balcony with two lounge chairs. We were only in the room to sleep at night anyway. It is located very close to Victoria Station Tube/Coach so getting around is easy. If you want a large, luxury hotel room go somewhere else! We would revisit the Alexander based on the great customer service and the price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cosy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would say this seems to be one of the better hotels on Belgrave Road. We checked around the street and many other places we saw were not up to scratch, but the alexander was on the whole excellent. Nice comfortable room with pretty furniture and the staff were polite and helpful and knowledgable too. They recommended a great restaurant nearby and I have to say it was one of the best meals we've had on any of our vacations over the years. The only problem I had was that our room was quite high up and there is no lift, but once you got there the room itself was actually very nice. Breakfast was also excellent, long live the great british fry up! Would I stay here again? Yes - the price was good and the service was warm and its in a good location close to the tube station. I don't know what the reviewer above smelt but we didnt smell anything bad the whole time we were there and our radiator also worked fine. I would certainly recommend the place to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff vs. Odd Smells”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Positives: The hotel has a great internet site that is easy to navigate, informative and reservations can made through the website. The staff, especially the wait staff, are very friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was good: eggs, bacon, toast, cereal, fruit, etc. The location is good, 5 minute walk from Victoria Station and other tourist sites, such as Westminster Abbey, were about a 15 minute walk. Best bar around was The Elusive Camel. The location was quiet and the bed was comfortable. Negatives: My room did not have a heater or radiator when I arrived, fortunately when I asked the front office the manager immediately grabbed a temporary radiator from his office and took it up to my room and plugged it in. The last night I stayed a radiator had been installed in my room, but it covered the cable outlet, and therefore I had no TV, and I could not get the new radiator to come on. There was a weird smell in the hallway and in my room. Opening the window during the day helped, but not quite enough. The bathroom had some mildew and the air vent was clogged with dust bunnies. Other than that, the room was clean. I would probably not stay here again, but the price is right for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Won't hesitate to stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Planning a trip to London, this is a great hotel to stay at! The employees went above & beyond to help us, they were really the best staff at a hotel myself or my girlfriend ( very frequent travelers ) have ever encountered. Not to mention the best breakfast we've had at a hotel ( who says English food is bad? )... These praises aren't idle folks, we really had a great trip, due in large part to this hotel. The downside of the hotel is, as with most hotels in the UK, the rooms are REALLY small. If you are traveling with more than 2 people, it will be a real tight fit. We had some friends stop back by the hotel at night & could barely fit the 4 of us in the room. But, if you are tripping thru London either by yourself or with a close friend, they won't come much better than this hotel...

HotelInfo.Name: Alexander Hotel London
HotelInfo.Address: 13 Belgrave Road, London SW1V 1RV, England
